Sun of Faith - English: Chapter I   In Tushita, the Bodhisattva becomes the divine son Svetaketu

Eons upon eons ago, when human life could last up to twenty thousand years, a bhagavan buddha named Kashyapa ('Od srung) appeared in Jambudvipa (Dzam bu gling), [on what we call the Earth, or] Land of the Plum-rose Trees.
Our teacher, the future Shakyamuni, was a young brahmin named Uttara (Bla ma) then.

At the close of his very long life, Uttara was reborn in the pure realm of Tushita (Dga' ldan) as the bodhisattva Svetaketu (Tog dkar po), and became the spiritual teacher of that celestial realm's gods.

Similar in his actions to all the bodhisattvas living through their penultimate life [before becoming a Buddha], he taught the authentic Dharma to the powerful gods and the other inhabitants of Tushita so as to lead them to perfect spiritual maturity.
Inscription - English: The Bodhisattva teaches dharma to the gods

Sun of Faith - English: And so, from then until the time when humans in the Jambudvipa world lived no more than a hundred years, Svetaketu sojourned in the realm known as Tushita in that one and same divine body.
